page.title: 09FARM TOUR TO SEE CROPS
page.content: We all got on a large farm trailer and went for a tour of the farm. On our way round we saw lots of fields. Some of the grass fields had cows in them. The ones that didn't were used for silage. The farmer used to cut it and make hay but it takes days to dry. Silage only needs one day. The grass is kept in 'clamps' or 'bunker silos' He lets it grow and cuts it once or twice then he puts the cows in the field. We saw fields of wheat and barley. The Spring Barley goes in the ground after the sugar beet. The barley is used for beer or animal food. The sugar beet goes to Bury St. Edmunds for processing the unused pulp comes back to feed the cows. There were several small areas of sweetcorn. These were cover and food for the pheasants. The farmer does not shoot but has friends that do. He rides.
